public abstract class BaseDAOImpl<E extends Entity>
extends org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.support.HibernateDaoSupport
implements BaseDAO<E>, InsertableDAO<E>, UpdatableDAO<E>, DeletableDAO<E>

Basic implementation for DAOs, extending Spring Framework support for Hibernate 3.

Author:
rafael, Ivan "Fireblade" Diana

delete

public int delete(boolean flush,
                  java.lang.Long... ids)
Description copied from interface: DeletableDAO
Remove permanently the entities whose identifiers are contained in the array ids, optionally flushing the changes to the database. Returns the number of entities removed. If any identifier does not correspond to any existent entity, do nothing on it and continue the deletion. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException.

Specified by:
delete in interface DeletableDAO<E extends Entity>
Returns:
the number of removed entities

delete

public final int delete(java.lang.Long... ids)
                 throws DaoException
Description copied from interface: DeletableDAO
Remove permanently the entities whose identifiers are contained in the array ids, flushing the changes to the database. Returns the number of entities removed. If any identifier does not correspond to any existent entity, do nothing on it and continue the deletion. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException.

Specified by:
delete in interface DeletableDAO<E extends Entity>

Throws:

duplicate

public <T extends E> T duplicate(T entity)
Description copied from interface: BaseDAO
Duplicates the entity, without copying collections
  • The identifier is not copied
  • All primitive and direct relationships (many to one) are copied
  • Collections are not copied

Specified by:
duplicate in interface BaseDAO<E extends Entity>

insert

public final <T extends E> T insert(T entity)
                         throws UnexpectedEntityException,
                                DaoException
Description copied from interface: InsertableDAO
Persists the new entity in the persistence layer, flushing the changes to the database. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException. Returns the persisted entity with the modifications made during the process. Generally, it means an identifier will be defined to the new persistent entity by the persistence layer. No guarantees are made about identifiers configured manually for transiente entities. In other words, implementors are not obligated to respect such identifiers.

If an already persistent entity is provided, just flush its state to persistence layer. Note that de identifier, in this case, cannot be changed to keep data integrity.

Specified by:
insert in interface InsertableDAO<E extends Entity>
Returns:
the persisted entity
Throws:
UnexpectedEntityException - If the entity is null or persistent
DaoException - if any problem happens in the underlying implementation

insert

public <T extends E> T insert(T entity,
                              boolean flush)
Description copied from interface: InsertableDAO
Persists the new entity in the persistence layer, optionally flushing the changes to the database. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException. Returns the persisted entity with the modifications made during the process. Generally, it means an identifier will be defined to the new persistent entity by the persistence layer. No guarantees are made about identifiers configured manually for transiente entities. In other words, implementors are not obligated to respect such identifiers.

If an already persistent entity is provided, just flush its state to persistence layer. Note that de identifier, in this case, cannot be changed to keep data integrity.

Specified by:
insert in interface InsertableDAO<E extends Entity>
Returns:
the persisted entity

load

public <T extends E> java.util.Collection<T> load(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Long> ids,
                                                  Relationship... fetch)
Description copied from interface: BaseDAO
Loads a collection of entities for the specified ids, populating the relationships defined by fetch, if any for each loaded entity. Returns the loaded entity. If the entity cannot be found, throws EntityNotFoundException.

Specified by:
load in interface BaseDAO<E extends Entity>

                            Relationship... fetch)
Description copied from interface: BaseDAO
Loads the entity identified by id, populating the relationships defined by fetch, if any. Returns the loaded entity. If the entity cannot be found, throws EntityNotFoundException.

update

public final <T extends E> T update(T entity)
                         throws DaoException
Description copied from interface: UpdatableDAO
Persists entity in the persistence layer, flushing the changes to the database. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException. Returns the persisted entity with the modifications made during the process.

The parameter entity cannot be a transient entity, it must be an already persisted one. If the entity is still transient a TransientEntityException will be thrown.

Specified by:
update in interface UpdatableDAO<E extends Entity>
Returns:
the persisted entity
Throws:
DaoException

update

public <T extends E> T update(T entity,
                              boolean flush)
Description copied from interface: UpdatableDAO
Persists entity in the persistence layer, optionally flushing the changes to the database. Any exception thrown by the underlying implementation is encapsulated in a DaoException. Returns the persisted entity with the modifications made during the process.

The parameter entity cannot be a transient entity, it must be an already persisted one. If the entity is still transient a TransientEntityException will be thrown.

Specified by:
update in interface UpdatableDAO<E extends Entity>
Returns:
the persisted entity

list

protected <T> java.util.List<T> list(QueryParameters query,
                                     java.lang.String hql)
Executes a query with minimal parameters, treating the query object as the source for named parameters

Parameters:
query - The query parameters contains the result type, named parameters as bean properties, the pagination parameters and the properties to fetch
hql - The HQL query
Returns:
A list, as returned by HibernateQueryHandler

list

protected <T> java.util.List<T> list(QueryParameters query,
                                     java.lang.String hql,
                                     java.lang.Object namedParameters)
Executes a query with a query parameters and a separate named parameters object

Parameters:
query - The query parameters contains the result type, the pagination parameters and the properties to fetch
hql - The HQL query
Returns:
A list, as returned by HibernateQueryHandler

list

protected <T> java.util.List<T> list(QueryParameters.ResultType resultType,
                                     java.lang.String hql,
                                     java.lang.Object namedParameters,
                                     PageParameters pageParameters,
                                     Relationship... fetch)
Execute a list with all possible parameters

Parameters:
resultType - The expected result type
hql - The HQL query
namedParameters - The HQL named parameters - May be a Map or a Bean
pageParameters - The pagination parameters, if any. It affects any ResultType, by limiting the number of results the same way as pages
fetch - The relationships to fetch
Returns:
A list, as returned by HibernateQueryHandler

map

protected <K,V> java.util.Map<K,V> map(java.lang.String hql,
                                       java.lang.Object namedParameters)
Executes a query, returning results as a Map. The result is expected to be an array, where the first element is the key and the second is the value
